page.title: 10TOURISM IN MARSDEN
page.content: { We are getting more tourists in Marsden than we used to. They come to see the canal and how the work is going on to make it fit for boats. The nicest parts of Marsden are Mellor's bridgr,the pack horse bridge by the vicarage, and Easter Gate,named after Esther who had an inn there.There is also a nice park in Marsden with a bowling green, a bandstand,and a tennis court. There is a small park at Rose Hill.There is a restaurant at Hey Green,and two cafes in the village.Sometimes walkers come to stay at the guest house by the Grey Cat on Brougham Road. {Dean Moorhouse and Michael Ball
